item.title: The demarcation problem
item.description:
Science is not so much a fixed set of beliefs (e.g. the Earth is a sphere, the stars are distant suns etc.) but rather a process for gaining knowledge using reasoning (in the form of mathematics, simulations etc.) and data to support certain claims. Quoting Boudry, Maarten (2020) Diagnosing Pseudoscience â€“ by Getting Rid of The Demarcation Problem. URL:(accessed 2022-10-31).

…as Thomas Paine put it, because their theories have nothing to do with reality. Science makes progress by taking bold risks and learning from mistakes, while pseudoscience dig in their heels and stick to their guns.
